definitions.definition: To habitually go to (someone in distress, sickness etc.) to comfort them. (Now generally merged into later senses, below.)
To go and meet (a person) as an act of friendliness or sociability .
examples: She decided to visit her grandparents for Christmas.

definitions.definition: Of God: to appear to (someone) to comfort , bless , or chastise or punish them. (Now generally merged into later senses, below.)
To punish , to inflict harm upon (someone or something).
Of a sickness, misfortune etc.: to afflict (someone).
To inflict punishment , vengeance for (an offense) on or upon someone.
To go to (a shrine, temple etc.) for worship . (Now generally merged into later senses, below.)
To go to (a place) for pleasure, on an errand, etc.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To habitually go to (someone in distress, sickness etc.) to comfort them. (Now generally merged into later senses, below.) [from 13th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , intransitive ) To go and meet (a person) as an act of friendliness or sociability . [from 14th c.]
( transitive ) Of God: to appear to (someone) to comfort , bless , or chastise or punish them. (Now generally merged into later senses, below.) [from 13th c.]
( transitive , now rare ) To punish , to inflict harm upon (someone or something). [from 14th c.]
( transitive ) Of a sickness, misfortune etc.: to afflict (someone). [from 14th c.]
( transitive ) To inflict punishment , vengeance for (an offense) on or upon someone. [from 14th c.]
( transitive ) To go to (a shrine, temple etc.) for worship . (Now generally merged into later senses, below.) [from 14th c.]
( transitive ) To go to (a place) for pleasure, on an errand, etc. [from 15th c.]
